repository.corpname: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation & Archives

did.abstract: This collection consists of "An Organizational Study of District Council 50, AFSCME," prepared by Sara Gamm, George W. Brooks, Ronald Donovan, and Eric Polisar in January 1966.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: George Brooks (July 12, 1908 January 27, 2000) was a professor at Cornell University's School of Industrial and Labor Relations.

A graduate of Yale University (BA, 1930) and Brown University (MA, 1932), Brooks worked for the National Mediation Board, National Labor Relations Board, and the International Brotherhood of Pulp, Sulfite, and Paper Mill Workers until he joined the ILR School in 1961. Brooks published in the Industrial and Labor Relations Review, Cornell Law Review, Review of Law and Social Change, and Monthly Labor Review.
See the Cornell University Faculty Memorial Statement for Professor George Brooks: http://ecommons.library.cornell.edu/handle/1813/17900

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of "An Organizational Study of District Council 50, AFSCME," prepared by Sara Gamm, George W. Brooks, Ronald Donovan, and Eric Polisar in January 1966.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: George W. Brooks Papers #/3042m. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: An Organizational History of District Council 50, American Federation of State, County, and Municipal Employees

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Prepared by Sara Gamm, George Brooks, Ronald Donovan, Eric Polisar, January 1966; 67 pages.
